text: [Urban Transportation](/news/urban-transportation)- 2 min read New plan to subsidise charging stations for 2 and 3-wheelers “This initiative aims to support deployment of 72,300 public charging stations (PCS) through a INR 2,000 crore allocation. Of these, 48,400 EV charging stations will be for two- and three-wheelers and 1,800 for buses,” an official said. New Delhi: The Centre has overhauled its plan to deploy electric vehicle (EV) charging stations by including subsidies for setting up two- and three-wheeler chargers. This is a significant development since earlier iterations of the EV subsidy scheme, called Faster Adoption and Manufacturing of Electric Vehicles (FAME), did not support deployment of two- or three-wheeler charging stations. Of these, 48,400 EV charging stations will be for two- and three-wheelers and 1,800 for buses,” an official said. In a directive issued in September, the power ministry maintained lower charges for charging EVs during solar hours (9 am to 4 pm). These ceiling rates are applicable till March 31, 2028, but are subject to an annual review, the ministry said. A final call on the per EV charger subsidy will also be taken by a project implementation and sanctioning committee (PISC) headed by secretary, ministry of heavy industries. “NHAI will oversee deployment of chargers at interstate highways and Indian Railways at stations.
